item.title: JavaOne and the forgotten Java edition
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
JavaOne is one of the biggest annual conferences to discuss Java technologies. It was inaugurated in 1996 by Sun Microsystems, and now is run during Oracle OpenWorld after the 2010 acquisition of Sun by Oracle Corporation. This year there was more excitement than usual around the JavaOne event, usually the event focuses on the technical […]

The post JavaOne and the forgotten Java edition appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.

item.title: Looking ahead: JVM Programming Languages
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
In this article I take a look ahead at the future of four programming languages; Java, Scala, Clojure and Kotlin. All four of these languages are designed to run on the Java Virtual Machine ( JVM ), which is supported on practically every computer operating system. Most recently, JVM programming languages have become popular choices […]

The post Looking ahead: JVM Programming Languages appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.

item.title: Refactoring a For-Loop to a Lambda in Java
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
This is a quick example to show refactoring a ‘for-loop’ over a List of objects by using a Lambda function instead. We will take a simple List of Message objects and simply output the name of the message. Typically you may want to perform various side affects instead of the outputting the object’s name on […]

The post Refactoring a For-Loop to a Lambda in Java appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.

item.title: Open Source programming environments that make coding easier
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
A programmer’s life is hard enough keeping up-to-date on the latest technologies, understanding product specifications, and debugging issues. These programming environments help keep programmer sane by offering integrated syntax coloring, auto-completion, debugging tools and more. The main tools on this list are also all Open Source projects themselves. This enables you to directly contribute to […]

The post Open Source programming environments that make coding easier appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.
